final_report.root_cause: MongoDB process in pod url-shorten-mongodb-75c967659f-2nk99 crashed immediately on startup because TLS/SSL initialization failed. The mongod server was configured to use TLS (mongod.conf) and a TLS Secret was mounted at /etc/tls; during OpenSSL initialization mongo triggered a fatal assertion (ssl_manager_openssl) and aborted (Exit Code 14), so the container entered CrashLoopBackOff. The most likely proximate cause is a bad/misconfigured TLS configuration or certificate/key (e.g., missing or malformed private key, incorrect cert format, or a mismatched path/permission) that caused OpenSSL initialization to fail. This explains why the failure started when the pod attempted to start with TLS enabled (likely after a config/secret change or pod restart).
affected_resources: URL-shortening storage functionality and any microservices that depend on the url-shorten-mongodb service (clients will see DB-unavailable / connection errors)
final_report.evidence_summary: kubectl_describe shows the pod in CrashLoopBackOff with Last State Terminated Reason=Error and Exit Code=14 and RestartCount >= 13. Container logs (get_logs) show a fatal assertion and abort originating from src/mongo/util/net/ssl_manager_openssl.cpp indicating OpenSSL/TLS initialization failed during mongod startup. The pod mounts a TLS Secret at /etc/tls and starts mongod using a mounted mongod.conf that enables TLS. The Service exists and correctly selects the pod labels and port 27017, but Endpoints is empty because the pod never becomes Ready.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority-1 investigation collected pod describe and container logs for url-shorten-mongodb-75c967659f-2nk99 and identified an immediate mongod process abort due to an OpenSSL/TLS fatal assertion (ssl_manager_openssl.cpp) while TLS was configured and a TLS secret was mounted. Image pull, scheduling and node-level issues were ruled out by successful pull/start events. Priority-2 verified the Kubernetes Service exists and is correctly targeted but has no endpoints since the pod is not Ready. Correlation of the TLS assertion, mounted TLS secret, and CrashLoopBackOff establishes the causal chain: TLS configuration/certificate problem -> mongod OpenSSL init failure -> mongod exits with Exit Code 14 -> pod CrashLoopBackOff -> Service has no endpoints -> URL-shortening storage unavailable to clients.

**Strict Iteration Policy:**
Only request another RCA iteration when the existing evidence is insufficient to produce a confident final diagnosis. Never re-run or re-request tasks already marked as completed or currently in progress. When additional work is unavoidable, list only the minimal set of pending task priorities in `tasks_to_be_executed` and clearly justify why each is required. If the current findings support a solid root cause, leave `tasks_to_be_executed` empty and finalize the report.

When you need more evidence, ask for the most targeted pending tasks that can close the causal gap (for example, verifying port mappings, credentials, or configuration values at both ends of a failing connection).
